info.title: RPC - Debug & Troubleshooting
info.description:
Cisco IOS-XE RPC Operations - Debug

**Category:** Debug Operations
**Modules:** 3
**RPC Actions:** 5

**HTTP Methods:**
- POST: Execute RPC action/operation

**Modules Included:**
- logging-ios
- tech-support
- trace

**RPC Operation Pattern:**
RPC operations are executed via RESTCONF POST to `/operations/` endpoints.
Each RPC accepts input parameters and returns output results.

**Example RPC Execution:**
```bash
POST /restconf/operations/Cisco-IOS-XE-rpc:ping
Content-Type: application/yang-data+json

{
  "input": {
    "ping-request": {
      "destination": "10.0.0.1",
      "repeat-count": 5,
      "size": 100
    }
  }
}
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
  "output": {
    "ping-reply": {
      "destination": "10.0.0.1",
      "request-count": 5,
      "reply-count": 5,
      "success-rate": 100,
      "minimum-rtt": 1,
      "average-rtt": 2,
      "maximum-rtt": 3
    }
  }
}
```

**Common Operations:**
- logging_ios_actions_rpc:send-log
- tech_support_rpc:tech-support-archive
- tech_support_rpc:tech-support-file
- trace_rpc:trace-archive
- trace_rpc:trace-message

post.description:
**Source Module:** logging-ios

To send a syslog message.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/logging_ios_actions_rpc:send-log`

post.summary: RPC message for tech-support archive generation
post.description:
**Source Module:** tech-support

RPC message for tech-support archive generation

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/tech_support_rpc:tech-support-archive`

archive.description:
Tech-support archive generate option.
         This is the only option and if this option is marked as 'true',
         tech-support archive will be generated.
         The tech-support file included in the archive will be equivalent
         to the output generated by 'show tech-support'.

file-name.description:
File name of the tech-support archive/file that will be generated. If
         the file-name is empty, it indicates that there was failure in the
         operation, possibly an internal error or another operation was being
         processed. In such cases, the reason for failure will also be
         attached to the response message. The arrival of response does not
         indicate that the operation is complete because the tech-support
         operation takes a huge amount of time to complete and notifications
         related to the execution can be consumed by subscribing to the tech-support
         event notification model which will contain the same file-name found in this
         response message.

post.summary: RPC message for tech-support file generation
post.description:
**Source Module:** tech-support

RPC message for tech-support file generation

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/tech_support_rpc:tech-support-file`

default-option.description:
This is option will gather all tech-support information, except for
             protocol-specific tech-support information. Selecting this option
             will generate tech-support file which contains data collected by
             the basic version of show-tech support CLI - 'show tech-support'.

file-name.description:
File name of the tech-support archive/file that will be generated. If
         the file-name is empty, it indicates that there was failure in the
         operation, possibly an internal error or another operation was being
         processed. In such cases, the reason for failure will also be
         attached to the response message. The arrival of response does not
         indicate that the operation is complete because the tech-support
         operation takes a huge amount of time to complete and notifications
         related to the execution can be consumed by subscribing to the tech-support
         event notification model which will contain the same file-name found in this
         response message.

post.description:
**Source Module:** trace

RPC for generating trace archive

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/trace_rpc:trace-archive`

file-name.description:
Name of the archive. When trace bundle is generated.
         File name is limited to 100 characters

Name of the archive. When trace bundle is generated.
         File name is limited to 100 characters

unique-id.description:
The unique identifier is a number which is generated for
         a successful trace archive rpc action.

post.description:
**Source Module:** trace

RPC for trace logging operations

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/trace_rpc:trace-message`

file-location.description: Location where file will be generated

file-name.description:
Name of the file that will be generated.
         A UTC date string will be appended to the file name and will be
         the name of trace bundle. For example, when RPC is fired with
         file name as 'trace-file' at 2021:01:01 01:01:01,
         the name of trace bundle will be  'trace-file-20210101-010101.tar.gz'.
         File name is limited to 100 characters

start-marker-type.description: Marker type start or start last to select logs

end-marker-type.description: Marker end start or end last to stop logging

start-marker.description: Display logs when a specific marker is found in file set

end-marker.description:
Stop displaying logs when a specific marker
         is found in file set

start-interval.description: Allows to fill value of start interval period

end-interval.description: Allows to fill value of end interval period

start-timestamp.description: Start time stamp for filtering log

end-timestamp.description: End time stamp for filtering log

filter-none.description:
Default option - no action needed by user.
             [Optional]: 'filter-none' can be set to true by user,
             though it is a default option. If the user intends to use any of the
             'filter-by-choice' options other than 'type-none', example -
             type-mac-address, type-ipv4-address etc. 'filter-none' will be set
             to default value and user need not modify this value.

mac-address.description:
MAC address filter. Make sure it
             is in 'aa:aa:aa:aa:aa:aa' format

switch-num.description: Set switch number 1 or 2 for logging

metadata.description: Display meta data for every log message

debug-level-id.description: Debug level for logging the logs

start-marker-type.description: Marker type start or start last to select logs

end-marker-type.description: Marker end start or end last to stop logging

start-marker.description: Display logs when a specific marker is found in file set

end-marker.description:
Stop displaying logs when a specific marker
         is found in file set

start-interval.description: Allows to fill value of start interval period

end-interval.description: Allows to fill value of end interval period

start-timestamp.description: Start time stamp for filtering log

end-timestamp.description: End time stamp for filtering log

timestamp.description: Use time stamp for filtering log

switch-num.description: Set switch number 1 or 2 for logging
